S.FORM: alra katikeriz! sungal!
’inavayan sinsi.
alra kayan.
’inavayan mapiya! i sinsi harem mu uri panaanadam kanta na akanen nanta piningaiyan na pinuyumayan mu kemuda ta marengay.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的卑南語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Pinuyumayan language for food.

S.FORM: sayhu u kinger za tu ngai ni sinsi?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: sinsi, ma’ulid ku. karuwa u ziya marengay parasan?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: ’azi ku kinger, kararuwa u kematamuni?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: alra na’u kani! iturusi ku miyup parasan.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: ’inava nu iayup.
asalru miyup parasan zi katamuniyu.
alra parapengan. amanan na vuri’awan.
alra pupanayu nanmu valray.
S.TRANSL: 請把你們的課本拿出來。

S.FORM: ai, sinsi.
alra pupanayu nanmu tratruli.
sinsi, malalup ku mada za tratruli.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: alra pupanayu nanmu aivas.
S.TRANSL: 請把你們的橡皮擦拿出來。

S.FORM: sinsi, malalup ku mada za aivas.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: alra kivulas kananu ’avalr za aivas.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: pavulasay ku za aivas mu?
katalaulepan lra zi temalaulepa ta.
S.TRANSL: Let’s take a break after class.

S.FORM: ta palruwanay kani, zi nu masalr na liyusan marepana’uwa ta lra.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: i eman u?
i Uyang ku.
i eman u?
tu alrak ku ni Arimek. i Malikaw ku.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Alimek, and my name is Malikaw.

S.FORM: i eman u?
tu temakakesi ku ni Umang. i Adraw ku.
S.TRANSL: I am a student in Umang, my name is Adraw.

S.FORM: i eman nanu ngadan?
i Takasi aku ngadan.
i eman tu ngadan ni temama?
i Pilang tu ngadan ni malri.
i eman intaw?
intaw mu maw i Uling.
i intaw mu maw i valri, i Tanuvak tu ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 他是我的哥哥，他的名字叫Tanuvak.
He is my brother, and his name is Tanuvak.

S.FORM: i intaw mu i eman tu ngadan?
tu ngadan mu maw i Ciming.
maw i Ciming tu ngadan?
ai, i Ciming tu ngadan.
tu ngadan maw i Marikaw?
melri, i Risem tu ngadan.
i eman iziyu na trau?
aina ku kanintaw, na maralrak kani nani. i Panay tu ngadan.
i eman iziyu na trau?
intaw mu maw i ngidalri, i Imay tu ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Imay。
She is my friend, her name is Imay.

S.FORM: pidaya nu ’ami harem?
muketrep ku ’ami harem.
pidaya tu ’ami harem intaw?
muketrep misama’ za zuwaya tu ’ami harem.
pidaya tu ’ami ni temama harem?
makalruwatr lra tu ’ami ni malri harem.
papida mu marewadiyadi?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: ulra ku vau a zazuwa zi sasa i wadilri.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: ulra nu vau a ma’inay?
uniyan ku za vau za ma’inay.
papida mu i ruma’ i savak.
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: aapat mi saruma’enan.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: temakakesi u i iyan?
temakakesi ku i Taihok.
i eman i intaw?
aama ku kanintaw maw na maralrak kani malri.
i temama nantu petris ni taina na ma’inay kiyakarun za eman?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: intaw mu kinsas.
i eman iziyu na trau?
intaw mu maw i valri na vavayan.
ulra tu kiyakarunan i vau na vavayan?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: intaw kiyakarun i biyoing.
marewadi nazu na zazuwa?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: melri, saali’an nazu.
melri, sangizayan nazu.
a yēncumin u?
ai, a Pinuyumayan ku.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I’m from the Puyuma tribe.

S.FORM: i turuma’anu mu maw na yēncumin?
ai, maw mu a Bunun i intaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, but he is a Bunun.

S.FORM: atras i temama?
ai, atras mi saruma’enan papiya.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: temakakesi lra i wadiu na vavayan?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: ai, temakakesi lra i intaw.
sayhu marengay za ta piningaiyan na wadiyu?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: ai, sayhu marengay za ta piningaiyan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: ulra papida anu petripetris?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: ulra ku petris a tatelu.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: salrangan u kazu kana temama za i taina?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: ai, salrangan ku kazu kana malri za i nani.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: salrangan u kazu kana temu?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ’azi, ’azi ku salrangan kazu kana mulri.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: salrangan u za i eman kazu?
salrangan ku kani malri za i nani zi i valri na ma’inay kazu.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: kemay i iyan u?
kemay Kalēnko ku.
kazu i iyan namu ruma’?
ulra i Valangaw nainiyam ruma’.
kazu i iyan namu zekalr aziyu ziya?
naku zekalr maw i Kalēnko.
ulra i iyan namu zekalr?
naniyam zekalr maw i Katratripulr.
nu aidan mu muruma’ u i zekalr?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: nu katalaulepan nu derun mu ka’azi ku muruma’.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: inku mu maw ku na Pinuyumayan na alrak.
kemuda na wari harem?
kemakadaw lra zi, vi’as na wari.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: aretid i patraran awa?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: aretid zi, puwapuwa mikavang.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: vi’as i patraran?
valiyan lra, ’azi vi’as.
kemuda na wari harem?
’azi aretid zi ’azi vi’as penauwa.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: nu karauv na wari mu kudaakuda awa?
iniyan za runev i rukup zi mupapanayan lra na vitu’en.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari i patraran.
maw ziya i dadali’, kemakadaw zi mupatraran na patrala’.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari i kaziyu kaninmu?
patrev na vali kania kaniniyam.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: ’inava a wari kazi kaninmu?
’inava, kemakadaw.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: awa ku lra i takesiyan.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: aretid na wari zi puwapuwa mikavang.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: wapatraran ku lra.
nu haremay mu uri paatrev na ’udalr zi amanan na malalup mada za suku.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: ’a’udalr?
zemerung a haremay zi, nu haremay mu alra mu uri ’a’udalr.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: ma’udalr lra?
’emudalr a haremay, dali’ lra harem.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: ma’udalr lra?
kamawan za ’emudalr lra, sapene’ na dadalan.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: ’ema’udalr? kemuda zi muzerem u?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: ’ema’udalr i patraran zi, ’azi ku mada za suku.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: ’inava u ziya?
patrev na vali, nu kurpavali ku mu nana ku tranguru’.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: ’inava u ziya?
vi’as na kadaw, kurkadaw ku zi mapungaw ku.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: malalup ku mada za tratruli.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: kuwa pevelasay u.
malalup ku mada za ’aratrip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: ’azi ku mada, kayta tremima’a.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.

S.FORM: kayta tremima’a za tratruli mu?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: ai, tratrima’ ku ziya za aivas.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: kayta tremima’a za kenanamain mu?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: ’azi ku auwa, piya ku lra kenama i ruma’.
S.TRANSL: No, I’ve already eaten at home.

S.FORM: malalup ku veni’as za ku trinavu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: pakunamun uwa vi’asu!
malalup ku mada za trinavu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: ta karakanaw nanku trinavu.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: nu kara’alriyan aekan u za eman?
S.TRANSL: What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: aekan ku i kungkuwan kana miēyo na kara’a’alrien.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: nu kara’alriyan aekan u za eman?
S.TRANSL: What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: mada ku za trinavu zi ta karkanaw nu kara’alriyan!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!

S.FORM: kayta malimaliya kana lanciw mu?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: ai! anlra.
kayta tremepuka kana yakkiw mu?
inau, takakesi ku.
alra alakanay ku za idap.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: ai, anzu ini na idap kuwa varanay kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: alakanay ku ziya za tupu a?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: maidap ku zi paalaku i Tanuvak.
S.TRANSL: I’m sweeping the floor, you ask Tanuvak to carry it for you.

S.FORM: piya u lra midap?
piya ku lra midap.
mazu ’azi u maidap?
piya ku lra midap.
milritra’ na tairu zi uwa itruli ziya.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: ai, kayku melaka za tupu.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: izu na lataw milritra’ zi uwa itruli ziya.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: nu haremay lra, ’azi ku ziya piya midap kani.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: kakuda u nu haremay?
awa ku maya’a kani sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: nu muruma’ u kemay kungkuwan mu kakuda u?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: salralrangan ku kanaku ali’ mukuwa semenaya.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: nu muruma’ kemay kungkuwan i intaw mu uri kakuda?
intaw awa pakulimaya.
kiumalra ku ziya ulra i ruma’ i Miing?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Miing is home?

S.FORM: ulra i ruma’ intaw, alra usavak.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: kiumalra ku ziya ulra i ruma’ i Milik.
uniyan i intaw wa, kiumalra ku ziya eman nanu ngangangai?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: maw i eman?
imu, maw ku i Piing, alra truwalray ku ziya.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I’m Piing, please open the door.

S.FORM: kiumalra ku ziya maw i eman u?
Ameng, i Uyang ku, zuwa ku maya’a kaninu kivangavanga.
S.TRANSL: ameng, I’m Uyang, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: sawariyan ta lra ’azi marepana’u.
ai yi! sare’ez ku kaninu. alra alamu kararengarengaya ta za ta kinudakudayan!
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

S.FORM: alra kayan, anzu a ociya alra ’aw.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: lrayuwan.
alra ’aw kana ociya.
wa kasa ’inava nu ’emau ta kanamu ociya.
alra mekana ta kana inaekan na vuwa’!
’inava yi! nanni na inaekan na vuwa’ kaimaramaran nu mena’u ta.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: imaran na inaekan na vuwa’?
ai , tatena’ za imaran.
piya lra demuru kana keraravien i nani zi alamu ekan!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: ai, murasa ku ziya za ku lima.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: tarekan zi tar’awu, maw ta saruma’enan zi melri nu trau u.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

S.FORM: vetrekel ku lra sazu lra ku inekan.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: kasazuyu mekan, amanan na maira.
ai, tena’ imaran.
averuk ku lra, nu dadaman zazuwa ku ziya mena’uwa kaninu.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: ai, marepana’uwa ta ziyan.
’aremeng lra, averuk ku lra i ruma’.
alamu ziya masalr kivangavanga yi.
kilrivak zi tawar lra.
ai, nu miwari u mu alamu lra kivangavang kaniniyam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: ’inavayan mapiya, harem kana wari inku na sinsi kuy adayaw mu mukuwa i zekalr kiumaumalra kana dawadawanan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: ’inava wa! iniyam mu karuwa mi temarkatratripulr marengay kana dawdawanan.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說知本語。
Okay! We’re going to say Katratripulr to the seniors.

S.FORM: raredek ta lra?
raredek ta lra.
imu, zuwa mi lra mena’uwa kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: wa sayhu mu lra marengay temarkatratripulr yi! salaw kana ’inava!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說知本語啊!真是太棒了!
You speak Katratripulr! That’s great! *Please change the language to your native language.

S.FORM: ’inavayan mapiya, harem kana wari inku na sinsi kuy adayaw mu mukuwa kikaruna kana ’uma na tinuhusan za dawa.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: ai, sinsi.
alamu uturik kania, amanan na malalup mada kana mu kiyakarun.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: ai, sinsi, mada mi lra kana niyam kiyakarun.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: medek ta lra?
’azi ta ziya medek, adawilr ziya.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: uwa i inu puzanumi.
ai, inkuwa na puzanum.
uwa alak za traptrapan na ’a’alrup kana ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: ai, kayku ’emalrupa kana ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: ’inavayan mapiya, harem kana wari awa ta kaziyu kana tunguyuan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: wa kana ’inava! kakuda ta mukuwa nay?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: waitras ta za bas mukuwa.
muturika ta, padadulu ta tremima’a za kippu.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ai.
i nganguwayan mu maw na ’ayam ziya, i likakuzan mu maw na unan ziya, inmuwaya lra na mena’una’u.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: sinsi kaakauz ku za unan.
muziya za eman, uwa na’u kana ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: nu lemavat za saya tuki mu uveliyas muwazuka ta.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: ai, lrayuwan sinsi.
eman nu ’ina’uwan kana wari harem?
mena’u ku lra sazu na unan zi sazu na ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: pakunamun, averuk ta lra.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: ngarayu ku ziya, rapi’ ku kuwi.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: salrangana ta mukuwa pakulimaya mu?
ai! anlra!
kazuwan na trau i kania pakulalima.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: asavak i kaziyua, kazuwa ta kania pakulimalima maruwa.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: kemuda u zuwa i kani?
kemakawang ku zuwa.
muitras u za eman palizingan zuwa?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: muitras ku za bas zuwa.
kemuda u mukuwa i kiyokay?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: tu puitrasaw ku i malri kana tu palizing salrangan mi mukuwa.
kana wari ziya kemuda mukuwa i kungkuwan i intaw?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: muitras za ciyēyun mukuwa i kungkuwan intaw.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: i temu na vavayan kemuda mukuwa tremima’a za sasiyawan?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: miotobay i mulri mukuwa tremima’a za sasiyawan.
S.TRANSL: 我奶奶騎摩托車去買菜。
My grandmother went to the grocery store by motorcycle.

S.FORM: kakuda u mukuwa i Vutrulr?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: waitras ku za sudang mukuwa i Vutrulr.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: kemuda mukuwa i Vutrulr i intaw?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: muitras za hikuki mukuwa i Vutrulr i intaw.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: muitras za eman palizing mukuwa i Takaw intaw?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: muitras kana pa’a’evut na kissiya mukuwa i Takaw i intaw.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: muitras za kissiya mukuwa i Valangaw intaw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ai, muitras za kissiya mukuwa i Valangaw intaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: i intaw mu muitras za kissiya mukuwa i Valangaw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: melri, muitras za hikuki mukuwa i Valangaw intaw.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: i kani dalrep mu ulra a waitrasan za bas?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: ulra , mungawayan ta mu nana’u ta kana waitrasan za bas.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: na adalrep kani na ciyēyun ulra i iyan?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: uniyan za ciyēyun i kania, maw maw a hayya karuwa u muitras.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: muitras ta za bas nu aidan raredek ta i kungkuwan?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: nu muketrep misama’ za lruwatra pungkang mu meredek i kungkuwan.
nu muitras ta kana pa’a’evut na kisiya nu aidan raredek ta i Taicung?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: nu saya tuki mu raredek ta i Taicung.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: nu pakakawang ta za palizing mukuwa i Ulay mu kasawarariyan?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: aruwa saya tuki.
muitras u za ciyēyun zuwa kaniyam kasawarariyan?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: aruwa makavetra’an pungkang.
sayhu u muitras za cidinsiya?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: sayhu ku muitras za cidinsiya.
ulra nu otobay?
ulra ku otobay a saya.
ulra nu otobay?
uniyan ku za otobay.
karuwa ku kiumaumalr kaninu?
karuwa, wawai ku.
karuwa ku kiumumalr kaninu?
’azi sazu ku kinazalram zi amanan kiumalray ku.
S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: miwari u nu alusu a kadaw? maranger ku mukuwa kiumaumalra kaninu kararuwa u nay?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: ai, kuwa ngarayaw u i ruma’.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: miwari u nu ’emanan? maranger ku zuwa kiumaumalra kaninu kana vativatiyan na Pinuyumayan.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於卑南族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary story of the Pinuyumayan.

S.FORM: auwa ku i zenan nu ’emanan zi, ’azi kuy kaazu i ruma’.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: mikiningeran ku za salaw u mazalram kana tu kakuwayanan na kinawatranan na Pinuyumayan zi, maranger ku mukuwa kipanadama kaninu.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對卑南族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Pinuyumayan, so I would like to ask you something.

S.FORM: ’azi sazu ku kinazalram, maw mu nanku kinazalram ziya mu kuy tatuvangaw u.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: kiumalra ku ziya kararuwa ku pasirep semasing awa? nu ta kuwaniyaw mu nu dadaman lra mara madulu lra nu venavalray ta.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: ai, kuwatreng za eman.
kiumalra ku ziya pidaya lra nu ’ami harem?
makaiwa mikasaleman za waluwaluwa lra ku ’ami.
tatena’ lralrak u ziya.
’azi, dawdawan ku lra.
kiumalra ku ziya kemay i iyan u?
kemay i Katratripulr ku.
kiumalra ku ziya kaninu i turuma’anu mu mawu a Pinuyumayan?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是卑南族人嗎?
Is your wife also a Pinuyumayan?

S.FORM: melri, intaw mu maw na Amis.
sayhu u marengay kana emaeman na piningaiyan?
sayhu ku marengay kana ngai za Pinuyumayan zi ngai za Amis.
S.TRANSL: 我會說阿美語和卑南語。
I can speak Amis and Pinuyumayan.

S.FORM: kana wari harem kasa ku semangal karuwa ku kiumaumalr kaninu, alra rengay ziya, kana pinakapalisi na watralunan mu?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: ai. a lralrak ku ziya mu marayas ku muzenan paalrupa.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: lrayuwan, salaw ’inava nanu ipanadam kaninku harem kana wari.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: naku irarengay mu maw na tatena’ peniya, tu iyavilin marengay nanta temuwamuwan.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: harem kana wari na ku kiyaumaumalr ta palruwanay kania. salaw lrayuwan kilrawa’ kananu kinazalraman.
S.TRANSL: 今天我的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
This is the end of my interview today. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: amanan na maira, masalra ta lra mazayazayar.
averuk ku lra, mengaraya ta ziya nu masalr mu maruwaya ku ziya kinger za marasazu za vativatiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: ai! alra tawar lra.
’inavayan, tratrima’ u za eman?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za kuppu saya.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: ’inavayan, tratrima’ u za eman?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za saya a talupung.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za kuppu, menaniwan mu nay?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: ulra, tratrima’ u za papidaya?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: menaniwan mu za puran?
’azi, ’azi mi menaniwan za puran.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za veras.
tratrima’ u za pidaya travu?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za telu travu.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy three packs.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za vurasi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: mupiya lra kiniwan na vurasi.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za zuwa dalilran na lrawlraw.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: niniyam lrawlraw musama’ lra za sadalilran.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle of oil left.

S.FORM: uwa trima’anay ku za vetrinun.
tratrima’ u za pidaya tingting?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: tratrima’ u za pidaya tingting na vetrinun?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za zuwaya tingting.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za zuwa vetu’ za kenaw.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: musama’ za telu vetu’ zi, trima’i peniya!
S.TRANSL: The remaining three, buy them all!

S.FORM: ini na satravu na veras mu pidaya paisu?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: na satravu mu zuwa leman paisu.
ta pukasayaw mu makavetra’an misama’ za saya paisu, makavetra’an paisu maruwa.
lrayuwan.
kani mu makaiwa misama’ za lruwatra paisu.
tremima’a ku ziya trmulrtrulr palru saleman paisu.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: peniya mu lruwatra leman misama’ za muketrep paisu.
aruwa u lalehet kanizu na muketrep paisu zi lruwatr leman lra naku vaveray kaninu mu?
S.TRANSL: 你可以少算10元而我就付500元給你好嗎?
Can you take $10 off and I'll give you $500?

S.FORM: pazangal zazu inia , karuwa u kemadulu pakiwalay?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，你可以算便宜一點嗎?
This is too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: ’azi , inia mu maw na dinulu lra.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku kanini na satravu na walru.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy this packet of candy.

S.FORM: ini na walru mu makatelun paisu, maranger u ziya tremima’ za zuma za eman?
S.TRANSL: 這糖30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for this candy, anything else you need?

S.FORM: karuwa ku kivelas za paisu kaninu?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: kemazu ziya maw! maranger u kivelas za manueman paisu?
S.TRANSL: 為什麼不可以啊!你需要借多少錢?

S.FORM: malalup ku mada za paisu, kararuwa ku kivelas za paisu kaninu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: yi, ’azi ku mada za paisu wa!
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any money either!

S.FORM: malalup ku mada za paisu, kararuwa ku kivelas za paisu kaninu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: inau, nanu kinivelas na paisu ’azi u ziya palauli’ kaninku.
S.TRANSL: 不要，你借的錢都還沒還我。
No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed.

S.FORM: kararuwa ku kivelas kananu kavang awa?
ai, alaku inu.
kararuwa ku kivelas kananu valray awa?
ku pavelasanay lra kani Punhi.
alra pavelasay ku kana nu cidinsiya mu?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: ai , maw mu nu ’emanan paveliyasu kaninku.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: ’ema’udalr lra zi, ’azi ku mada za suku, pavelasay ku za suku mu?
S.TRANSL: 正在下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It’s raining. I don’t have an umbrella. Can I borrow one?

S.FORM: maw maw saya a ku suku zi, salrangana ta misuku!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

S.FORM: ini na valray mu maw nanu ipavelas kaninku a daman zi ku palauli’aw kaninu.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，我還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I’ll give it back to you.

S.FORM: nu marangher u ziya mena’u za eman valrayan kararuwa u marengay kaninku.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: maw nu aidan pavelaliyas ku za paisu kaninu?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: muziya za eman, nu ulra lra nu paisu mu rengay lra.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It’s okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: nu aidan pavelaliyas u za paisu kaninku?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: ku paveliyasaw nu ’emanan kaninu.
S.TRANSL: I’ll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: nu aidan palaauli’ u kananku valray?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: ku palauli’aw lra adaman kaninu kemaku?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: ini na tratruli mu tu ipavelas ni Risem kaninu?
S.TRANSL: Did Risem lend you this pen?

S.FORM: ai, ninku kinivelas kanintaw harem kana wari.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: ini na tratruli mu nu kinivelas kani Risem?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Risem?

S.FORM: melri, ini mu tu trinima’an ni nani.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: iniyan lra za ’ateri uwa kivelas kani Imay za saeman za ’ateri.
S.TRANSL: We’re out of salt, let’s go borrow some from Imay.

S.FORM: ai, kay ku kivelasa.
uwa rengayu i Panay za palauli’an za ku paisu.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Panay to give me back my money.

S.FORM: manueman paisu atu kiyam kaninu?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: auwa u i iyan?
auwa ku i padurina’an semalema za kulang.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: makuda u?
traluwalun lra zi remarevay ku, nu haremay mu puwazanum ku.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在除草，等一下要澆水。
There’s too much grass, I’m mowing, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: alakanay ku za ringaw zi pitaw mu?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: nu tra’anay i iyan ziya maw?
ulra ipuwa kana kangkang zi dipdip i ngidiran.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: nu vuliyasaw lra na dare’?
S.TRANSL: Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: maw ku ziya vulaliyas kana dare’, nu haremay ’apiyar ku lra.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: nanu isalem na kulang aruwa ta lra kikulang?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: na i kania na tamana mu aruwa lra, na i kaziyu na tangungu mu ’azi ziya kararuwa kikulang.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: wa! nu kivurasiyaw a sakuniyani sazu a vurasi.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: pulralrangay ku puwa i suru mu?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: kemakuda mu?
papuwa mi za ’aray za kiyavulraw.
S.TRANSL: We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: sazu a vulraw i kani?
sazu lra nanta kinivulraw ulra i savak kana kari’is.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經裝了很多我們抓的魚。
The fish traps are already full of fish that we caught.

S.FORM: nu mukuwa u kivulrawa mu kemuda u kivulraw?
S.TRANSL: How do you catch fish when you go to catch them?

S.FORM: mitatusuk ku temusuk kana vulraw.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: sayhu u penana’ kana makazenan na haramehaman?
S.TRANSL: 你會用弓箭打山上的動物嗎?
Do you shoot at the animals on the mountain with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: inku mu penapetrir kirawa, nueman mu mikuwang ku zi mada ku za suwan mukuwa pa’alrupa.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗圍獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I will fence with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: tu wakalr za vavuy inia.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: mazu mazalram u?
nintu dinapalran za vavuy inia, maw izu na inia mu tu wakalr za vavuy.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: pakunamun uwa na’uwi nanta petrir, kamawan za karasa lra za rawa.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: mazu mazalram u?
na suwan kamawan za tremaulr. pakunamuna ta kurelrang mukuwa.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.

S.FORM: eman nanu dinadaway harem?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: inia mu maw na varasa’ na demadepel na petrir, papetrir za tutus.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: a eman nanu ipuwa i kazu?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: izua mu maw na venetatevet kana kuwi na petrir, niniyam papetrir za ’ura.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: lrayuwan kemaya ta semungal kana ta temuwamuwan za tu ipuvavate kaninta, sazu ta kinarasa na rawa harem kana wari.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: ai! ta adayaw muruma’ i zekalr ta kara’aru’arusaw.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落 一起分享吧!
Yeah! We bring back the tribe. Let’s share!

S.FORM: harem kana wari i sinsi mu uri panaanadam kanta na haramehaman nanta piningaiyan na pinuyumayan mu kemuda ta marengay.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的卑南語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Pinuyumayan language today.

S.FORM: harem kana wari i sinsi mu uri panaanadam kanta na tematelriw nanta piningaiyan na pinuyumayan mu kemuda ta marengay.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的卑南語怎麼說。

S.FORM: harem kana wari i sinsi mu uri panaanadam kanta na inaekan na vuwa’ nanta piningaiyan na pinuyumayan mu kemuda ta marengay.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的卑南語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Pinuyumayan language today.

S.FORM: amanan na alrupe’.
amanan na vuri’awan.
amanan na mekan za eman ziya.
pupanayu nannu valray.
pupanayu nannu tratruli.
pupanayu nannu vavalrayan.
lrasedu nanmu valray.
lrasedu nanmu tratruli.
lrasedu nanmu akanen.
lrasedu nanmu ’aya’ayam.
ni eman impic ini?
maw nanku.
ni eman valray ini?
tu ni Uyang.
ni eman aivas ini?
’azi ku mazalram.
tu kavang ni Uyang izu?
melri, ini mu tu pakatras ni Imay.
sinsi, ’azi ku mada za valray.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: salrangan kananu ’avalr na’u.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: muritru’ lra naku impic.
vavalrayi kana yēncepi.
malremes ku aivas.
ku pavelasay u kana ku aivas.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: katalaulepan lra, waruma’ mu kilrivak nu kazu mu i dadalan.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心。
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: ai. lrayuan sinsi.
katalaulepan ta lra, marepana’uwa ta ziyan.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: marepana’uwa ta ziyan sinsi.
’inavayan mapiya, i Acin aku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Acin.

S.FORM: Acin ’inavayan.
’inavayan mapiya, nanku ngadan mu maw i Atēk.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Atēk.

S.FORM: Atēk ’inavayan.
’inavayan, i Acin ku.
Acin ’inavayan, i Siging ku.
’inavayan, i Atēk ku.
’inavayan, i Siging ku.
i eman u?
tainataw ni Risem ku, i Tivuan ku.
i eman u?
waditaw ni Singkuy ku, i Miing aku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 我是Singkuy的妹妹，我的名字是Miing。
I am Singkuy’s sister. My name is Miing.

S.FORM: i eman i intaw?
intaw mu maw naku sinsi, i Risem intaw.
i eman iziyu na trau?
intaw mu maw i valri, i Takasi intaw.
maw i Acin intaw?
ai, intaw mu maw i Acin.
maw i Acin u?
melri, maw ku i Sigēng.
i eman i Acin?
maw ku i Acin.
maw i eman i Siging?
i Silung mu maw i ali’lri.
i eman tu ngadan ni vau na vavayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: tu ngadan ni valri na vavayan mu maw i Araytay.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Araytay.

S.FORM: i eman tu ngadan ni wadiyu na vavayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: tu ngadan ni wadilri mu maw i ’Avasan.
mazalram u kana tu ngadan?
maw i Acin intaw.
pidaya lra tu ’ami ni vau na ma’inay?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: muketrep misama’za lruwatra lra tu ’ami harem.
pidaya lra tu ’ami ni wadiyu na ma’inay?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: lruwatra lra tu ’ami harem.
ulra a kungkuwan kananemu zekalr?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: ulra.
temakesi u kananemu zekalr na kungkuwan?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: ai, temakesi mi i kungkuwan kamawan mi za saruma’enan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: i eman iziyu na ma’inay?
intaw mu maw i ama na maralrak kani malri.
i eman iziyu na vavayan?
intaw mu maw i valri na vavayan.
i eman iziyu na alrak?
maw i wadilri na ma’inay.
kiyakarun za eman i taina?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: a hitay i intaw.
kiyakarun za eman i temama?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: a sinsi i intaw.
intaw mu maw i wadiyu?
melri, tu ali’ ni wadilri na ma’inay.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: maw i vau na vavayan i intaw?
melri, maw i wadilri na vavayan intaw.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: papida nazu na saruma’enan?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: lralruwatr trauwan nazu saruma’enan.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: papida a lralrak kanmu i ruma’?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: aapat mi na lralrak.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: ulra papida na wadiyu?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: iniyan ku za wadi za ma’inay, ulra tatelu aku wadi a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: papida anu vau?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: iniyan ku za vau.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: papida mu maruwadiyadi?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: iniyan ku za petripetris.
marewadi mu?
ai, maw i valri na ma’inay intaw.
a yēncumin mu?
ai, a yēncumin mi.
intaw mu mawu a pinuyumayan?
ai, intaw mu mawu a pinuyumayan.
kemuda na wari harem?
puruaretid na wari harem, tar ’awu kana zanum na vi’as.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari harem?
puruvi’as na wari, puwapuwa ’emawu za zanum.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari i patraran?
vi’as na kadaw, ikalaalup zamu sasulev ’aziya mu kurkadaw.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari i patraran?
kezemel na runev, ’azi kemakadaw.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: na wari nu ’emanan kemuda awa?
nu ’emanan ’azi kakadaw, kezemel na runev, patrev na vali.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari a azu?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: nu azu na wari puru’aretiz, zi nu mupatraran mu mu, pikavang za pakatras.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: nu katalaulepan mu kemuda na wari awa?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: katalaulepan nu azu na wari mu makadaw zi sadeku.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: nu azu mu ’a’udalr awa?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: makadaw na wari nu azu, ’azi ’a’udalr.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: ’a’udalr nu azu awa?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: ai, ’a’udalr nu azu.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: ma’udalr harem?
dali’ lra, mupana lra na kadaw.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: ma’udalr harem?
’ema’udalr, ’azi ku mada za suku.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: ma’udalr i patraran?
’azi ma’udalr harem, ’a’udalr nu piya ta kara’alri, nu wapatraran mu ada za suku.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: nu mari’ami nu vetreliyan kaararetid awa?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ai, kaaretid nu mari’ami nu vetreliyan, piyakavang ta za sazu za kavang.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: kana ’ami harem nu derun mu kavi’as awa?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ai, kavi’as nu derun, tar’awu za zanum.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: sahar u kana kaseveran?
sahar ku kana kaseveran, sadeku na wari.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: sahar u kana venetratreli?
’azi ku sahar kana ventratreli, sazu a variw nu venetratreli.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: malalup ku mada za valray.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: salrangana ku kaninu mena’u.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: malalup ku mada za aivas.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: ku pavelasay u.
malalup u mada za tratruli?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: ai, pavelasay ku zanu tratruli mu?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: kara’a’alri u za eman?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: aekan ku za pang.
keraravi u za eman?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: aekan ku za maderu.
kenama u za eman?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: mekan ku lra za vetrinun.
eman nu kinara’alri?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: mekan ku za ’alum za vuyu.
kayta tremapi’iya za mali.
kinganguwayan mukuwa, nu haremay ku aya’aw u.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: kayta pakulimaya.
alra, salrangana ta mukuwa.
kayta malimaliya.
’azi, kayta ziya makutra za valray.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: mengangisil u lra?
’azi ziya, lremalrisaw ku ziya kana kisikisi.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: ’ematimurmur u lra?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: ’ematimurmur ku lra.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: lremisaw u lra kana kisikisi?
piya ku lra lremisaw kana kisikisi.
kemazu zi ’azi u muras?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: nu haremay lra auras ku lra.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: makuda u a haremay?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: mukuwa ku maya’a kana sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: nu parkipiya u i kungkuwan nu muruma’ u mu kakuda u?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: payas ku muruma’.
nu muruma’ kemay i kungkuwan mu kakuda intaw?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: auwa malikasawa i intaw.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Abi, ulra u i ruma’?
ulra ku i ruma’, alra usavak.
Abi, ulra u i ruma’?
uniyan i ruma’ i Abi, i Imay ku, eman nanu ngangai kantaw? nu muruma’ kuwa umalray lra.
S.TRANSL: Abi不在家耶，我是Imay，有什麼事嗎？回來我會轉告Abi。
Abi is not at home. I am Imay. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: i eman mu?
imu, i Avas ku za i Abi, truwalray mi ziya.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Avas和Abi，幫我們開門。
Grandma, we are Avas and Abi, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: i eman u?
i Buya ku, zuwa ku maya’a kani Umang.
S.TRANSL: I am Buya, I am here for Umang.

S.FORM: imu, zuwa ku mena’uwa kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: sawariyan u lra ’azi zuwa, zi salaw ku sare’ez kaninu.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Abi, zuwa ku muzazangiya kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Abi, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: pakunamun musavak, sawriyan ku za mengangara kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: ninku sinalem inia na vurasi, zi talrami mekan!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看！
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: kasa tavu’ ini na vurasi.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: alamu! ninku isalem ini na inaekan na vuwa’, talrami mekan.
S.TRANSL: 過來！這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: kasa tavu’ ini na inaekan na vuwa’.
alra kayan! inia na kudumu mu maw ninku isalem na ’azi pinutremelan talrami mekan!
S.TRANSL: 請坐！這是我種的有機玉米吃看看！
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: wa! salaw tavu’ ini na kudumu.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: aekan u za vartenuk?
aku karuwa mekan za vartenuk, mekana ku za lingo maruwa.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: aekan u za walru?
ai, kasa ku sahar.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: ku kulitranay u za inaekan na vuwa’ pakan kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: lrayuan, salaw mizanum ini na inaekan na vuwa’.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: kuwa alakanay u za zanum pa’aw mu.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: lrayuan.
kasazuyu mekan, sazu ku tinusasiyaw.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: wa! kasa lringulr zi aresasiyaw.
S.TRANSL: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: kasazuyu mekan, sazu ziya i kania.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: ’azi kuy kaaira yi!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: kasazuyu mekan, sazu ziya i kani.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: sazu lra ku inekan, ’azi ku lra kararuwa mekan.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: harem kana wari inku i sinsi kuy adayaw mu mukuwa i zenan.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: i nani marengay i zenan sazu a pedped.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: harem kana wari inku i sinsi kuy adayaw mu mukuwa i ’uma.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: awa mi veneliyasa kana dare’?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: awa ta i iyan harem kana wari?
i sinsi tuy adayaw ta mukuwa i zinanuman.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: awa ta i iyan harem kana wari?
na sinsi tuy adayaw ta mukuwa i zenan.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: harem kana wari awa ta i zinanuman?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ’azi, i sinsi tuy adayaw ta mukuwa i zenan.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: harem kana wari awa ta i zenan?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: ’azi, harem kana wari awa ta i ’uma.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: sinsi, awa ta i zinanuman mena’uwa za eman?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: awa ta mena’uwa kana tengteng.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, awa ta i zenan mena’uwa za eman?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: awa ta mena’uwa kana sirusirupan.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: mukuwa ta i ’uma kakuda ta?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: awa ta i ’uma mena’uwa kananta isalem na kudumu, kilrivak ulra a ’ivavereng zi ulra ’alrivatrengan.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻和蜜蜂唷。
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: sinsi awa ta i zinanuman pakulimaya?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: ’azi, awa ta mena’uwa kana tengteng.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi awa ta i ’uma semalema za kulang?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: harem kana wari awa ta veneliyasa kana dare’.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: i kazu ulra a tengteng muviivii.
harem kana wari mena’u ku kana tatena’ na vaavaaw na tengteng.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: i kaziyu ulra a sirusirupan muvaviivii.
wa! sahar ku kana sirusirupan, salaw vulay.
S.TRANSL: Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: i kaziyu ulra a sirusirupan a muvaviivii.
izu melri nu sirusirupan, ’alrivatrengan nazu.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: kazu i kani mena’una’u, amanan na mukuwa i dawilr mu!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷！
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: ai, ’azi mi awa i dawilr.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: amanan na pavekas, tawatawar kemakawang munu kurtapelra’ u.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: maranger ku za dika mena’u.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: kemuda u mukuwa i talraviyaw?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: mipalizing ku mukuwa i talraviyaw.
kemuda mukuwa i biyoing intaw?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: kemakawang intaw mukuwa i biyoing.
kemuda u mukuwa i Bokoto?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: muitras ku za hikuki mukuwa i Bokoto.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: kemuda u mukuwa i Bokoto?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: muitras ku za sudang mukuwa i Bokoto.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: muitras u za eman muruma’?
muitras ku za ciyēyun muruma’.
muitras za eman i Varikay mukuwa i kungkuwan?
S.TRANSL: How does Varikay go to school?

S.FORM: muitras za kissiya i Varikay mukuwa i kungkuwan.
S.TRANSL: Varikay goes to school by train.

S.FORM: muitras za eman i Varikay mukuwa i kiyokay?
S.TRANSL: How does Varikay go to church?

S.FORM: midinsiya i Varikay mukuwa i kiyokay.
S.TRANSL: Varikay goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: muitras u za ciyēyun mukuwa i kungkuwan?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: melri, muitras ku za bas mukuwa i kungkuwan.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: midinsiya u mukuwa i kungkuwan?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: ai, midinsiya ku mukuwa i kungkuwan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: muitras u kana pa’evut na kissiya mukuwa i Takaw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ai, muitras ku kana pa’evut na kissiya mukuwa i Takaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: nu mukuwa u i Valangaw muitras u za kissiya za muitras u za hikuki?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: muitras ku za hikuki, muitras ta kana hikuki mu maradika kana kissiya.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: nu mukuwa u i kiyokay mu, muitras u za bas alra mu midusiya u?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: midusiya ku mukuwa i kiyokay, nu midusiya ta mu marakalra’ayan ta kana bas.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: adalrep mu ruma’ i cawse?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: ’azi adalrep, miotobay ku mukuwa i cawse.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: na yubingkiyok adalrep i kungkuwan?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: adalrep, nu kemakawang ta mu medek ta.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: na aekanan mu adalrep i siyataw?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: mupatraran ta kemay i siyataw kemakawang ta mu lruwatra pungkang medek ta.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: miwari u harem kana wari?
kemuda ziya maw?
maranger ku mukuwa muzazangiya kaninu.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: ulra ku vangavangan harem kana wari zi uniyan ku i ruma’, nu daman lra mu.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, nu ’emanan miwari u? nu alusu kadaw kayku maya’a kaninu.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: ai, kuwa ngarayaw u i ruma’.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: kiumalra ku ziya karuwa ku pasirep nay? maranger ku venavalray semama’.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: ai, kuwatreng za eman.
karuwa ku semasisasing?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: ’azi ku vulay zi amanan sasingaw ku, pawnung’azi tinulre’ay parapet na suru!
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦！
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, kuwa sasingngaw maruwa.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: amanan sasingaw.
lrayuan nu pazuwayaw ku pakiumaumalr.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: kuwatreng za eman, maranger u kiumalr za eman?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: kiumalra ku kaninu a lralrak u ziya kiyakarun u za eman?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: aziyu ziya kinsas ku, maw mu remetra’ ku lra harem.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: harem mu ulra nu kiyakarunan?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: sangpan ku i kungkuwan.
kiumalra ku nannu lralrak mu ulra kaazu i zekalr?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ’azi, nanku lralrak ulra kaazu i tokay papiya.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, sasa u na kaazu i zekalr?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: ulra ku vinaaw a saya suwan zi saya ’ayam, nazu mu ninku rinuma’enan.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: mivinaaw ku za saya ngiyaw, ulra ini na ngiyaw ku lraalrang ’azi ku kasalrengangeseng.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: maranger ku kiumalr kaninu kanini na watralunan na palisiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: ’azi ku kamazalraman, maw mu naku kinazalram kuy tuvangaw u.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: nanmu adain mutralun izu na petrir, na vakenan na ilrus mu ulra tu palisiyan?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: nazu na adain mutralun na eman ziya mu ’azi madikes na vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, na vavayan mu karuwa salrangan mukuwa mutraluna?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: ’azi, na vavayan ’azi muwatralun.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: kana wari harem salaw ku semangal karuwa ku kiumaumalr kaninu, alra rengay ziya, kana pinakapalisi na watralunan mu?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today. Would you please talk about the taboos of hunting?

S.FORM: ai. a lralrak ku ziya mu marayas ku muzenan paalrupa.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Sure, I used to go hunting very often when I was young.

S.FORM: Uyang, iniyan lra za kutra i ruma’, uwa trima’ za kutra.
S.TRANSL: Uyang，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Uyang, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: amanan tremima’! ulra ziya sadalilran i sawka.
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: ’azi pauwa na sadalilran, uwa trima’ ziya za zuwadalilran.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za biciw, menaniwan mu?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: ulra, manueman nu tratrima’en?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za zuwa dalilran, zi tratrima’ku ziya za saluvukan za veras.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: anzini na veras i kani, tratrima’ u ziya za eman?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku ziya za vetrinun, ulra mu vetrinun?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: muniwan lra peniya na vetrinun.
tratrima’ ku za kavang.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: maranger u kana kemudakuda na kavang?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku kana lriketri tu ’aselr na kavang.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: ini na zangzarang kemudakuda ziya maw?
ulra na kirekamelri tu pinivalrayan?
ulra ziya na vulretri maw na temangiya.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: alakanay ku za saya izu na temangiya na kavang.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Arung mukuwa u i iyan haremay? mukuwa u leminalinaya?
S.TRANSL: Arung你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Arung, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ’azi, mukuwa ku pulralranga meniwana za kulang ni imu.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: kemazu kuwayu, miwari u nu karauv? wawai u salrangan kaninku mukuwa mekana.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: ’azi, awa ku tremima’a za kavang.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu salrangana ku kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: ’inavayan, kiumalra ku ziya ini na savetu’na kulang manueman paisu?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: na kulang savetru’makavetra’an paisu.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: ini na vurasi manueman paisu?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: na vurasi saya tingting mu makatelun paisu.
alra ’ay ku za zuwa vutu’ za kulang zi saya tingting za vurasi.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Acin, malalup ku mada za tratruli, karuwa u pavelas kaninku?
S.TRANSL: Acin，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Acin, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: iniyan nanku, ini mu tuni Imay.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Imay’s.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu karuwa pavelas kaninku? kadadika ku palawli’ kaninu.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: ai, alaku.
lrayuan, lrayuan kuwayu lra i Imay.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Imay for me.

S.FORM: maranger u za eman?
pareveliyas ku kananni na zuwa’etiv na valray.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: ai, maranger u ziya za eman?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: kiyavelas ku ziya za telu ’etiv a valray.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: maruwa lra. amanan na malalup pakalrang nu telu wariyan mu palawli’u lra.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: ’azi u ziya palawli’ za ku aivas.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: ku palawli’aw lra a adaman zi.
kemazu zi malremes ku aivas awa?
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了？
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: nu pavelasanay kani Uratr maku?
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Uratr?

S.FORM: aku mazalram kayku kiumalray.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: ku pavelasay u ziya kanaku aivas.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Imay, ini na kaytu tu ipavelas i Uratr kaninu?
S.TRANSL: Imay, did Uratr lend you this coat?

S.FORM: melri, tu trinima’an ni nani veray kaninku.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: maresan tu kaytu ni Kacaw kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: tu kaytu mu maw na ’uze’uzem, ’azi maresan tu pinivalrayan.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Imay, kivelas u kani Uyang za paisu?
S.TRANSL: Imay, did you borrow money from Uyang?

S.FORM: ai, pavelaliyas ku kanintaw kema ku mu, malalup ku lra mada za paisu.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu nu aidan palawli’ u?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: ku palawli’aw nu ’emanan kantaw.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ai, ku rengayanay lra kani Uyang nannu ikakuwa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Uyang for you.

S.FORM: nu penetrir ta kana tutus mu, ta petriray kana penangangese’, na tikuray nu penetrir ta mu, ta petriray kana venetatevet, ta kuwaniyaw penetrir mu penauwa.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: kemania kuwayu, pamelri ku penetrir! aziya lra eman ’azi ku karaasa.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu kunu panadamaw demaway kanini na zuwaya na petrir.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: ai! salaw ’inava! nu kuazu mu kararuwa ku lra karasa.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: tatelrawan lra na tralunan i ’uma zi, uwa i suru elak za ringaw, kayta i ’uma.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: ipuwa i iyan na ringaw?
ulra i ngidiran kana tripe’, nu musavak u i suru nana’u u.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍(穀物乾燥簍)的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: kilrivak, amanan na mupanana. ’idangan na ringaw.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: amanan da’elray izu naku ipetrir!
ulra i iyan izu nanu ipetrir?
naku petrir ulra ipetrir kanizu na kawi i maka lusu.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: mazu ’azi u malalup?
ulra ku pinudungan, mazalram ku za ulra i iyan ku petrir.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: surunung ini, ta puwanay i ngidiran i zinanuman kivulraw.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: i kazi kaniniyam iniyan za surunung, mi pangasingasipay nu kivulraw mi.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: ’azi ku ziya pangasip kivulraw, nu masalr mu panadamaw ku mu?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ai! nu masalr mu salrangana ta mukuwa pangasipa.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: nu kemazu kunuwa panadamaw demaway za surunung.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: mahuwahu nanu pangasip, alra mu karasa za vulraw! pakunamun kezengu.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: nu haremay lra, na sudang ma’iva’iv zazu. kuwa kezengaw na pangasip, zi uwa kaziyua pulralrangay ku melak za savang.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: izu na vulraw kezengu pukuwania kaninku. kuwa pulralrangay u kemezeng.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: kasa ’inava! harem sazu ta kinarasa, matemuy lra na kara’is.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: anlra dikadikaya ta muruma’ ta lrawalrawa’ay papiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: zuwa lra na sinsi.
amanan lra kivangavang, kunamun uwa kanannu kakayanan.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: irayan! piwari ku lra!
kunamun usavak.
liyusan pida harem?
liyusan lruwatr harem, katalaulepan nu ’emanan, salrangana ta mukuwa kivangavanga!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: halra! kayta i zinanuman.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: liyusan pida nu ’emanan?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: liyusan telu nu ’emanan, nu ’emanan nu alusu kadaw kayta malimaliya!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: nu ’emanan nu semavalr kakuda u?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: kasede’an nu ’emanan, salralrangan ku kani nani mukuwa i kiyokay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: kemuda u?
uri auta’ ku, auwa ku i tavununan muta’a.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: wa ku kana mapungaw.
mihelrapa u kana to temalaulep.
sinsi, nana ku tiyalr, auwa ku i tavunan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: ai, pakunamun uwa.
karuwa ku mukuwa murasa zaku lima?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: uri talaulep ta lra, uwa lra nu haremay.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi, kasa nana ku tranguru’, nu piya kara’alri puwalawang ku.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: ai, kilrivak nu muwaruma’ u.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: sinsi, nu masalr liyusan sa puwalawang ku, auwa ku kina’uwa kana ising.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: ai, tarenapawi nanu zazek.
ulra i iyan i Sunay?
nana tu tiyalr, ulra i tavunan.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: ulra i iyan i Masaw?
sinsi, nana tu tukeraw, puwalawang harem kana wari.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Masaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: mazu ’azi ziya zuwa i Sunay?
tu pakavi’asaw.
alra pakazalramay ta ziya kaninu.
ku ngadan mu maw i Uyang Pakaruku, muketrep lra ku ’ami harem.
S.TRANSL: My name is Uyang Pakaruku, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: i eman nanu ngadan?
ku ngadan mu i Uyang Pakaruku.
tu alrak u na iyan na mawan?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: tu alrak ku za Pinuyumayan.
a Yēncumin papiya nu rinuma’enan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ai, iniyam saruma’enan Pinuyumayan mi papiya.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是卑南族人。
Yes, my whole family is Pinuyumayan.

S.FORM: a Yēncumin papiya nu rinuma’enan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: melri, a Pinuyumayan i malri zi, a payrang i nani.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是卑南族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Pinuyumayan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: ni eman alrak u?
tu alrak ku ni Masaw Mavaliw.
iziyua mu maw i temama? pidaya lra tu ’ami?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: makanemaen lra tu ’ami.
i iziyu mu maw i temama? pidaya lra tu ’ami?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: melri, i intaw mu maw na dawdawanan i kaniyam zekalr, makawalun lra tu ’ami.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pidaya lra tu ’ami ni vau na ma’inay?
muketrep misama’ za waluwaluwa lra tu ’ami ni valri na ma’inay.
tu ’ami ni vau mu ’ma’izang zazu kaninu?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: marama’izang kaninku za lruwatr ’ami i valri na ma’inay.
manueman nanu ikaaatras?
sakelawangan zi zuwa pasa ku ikaaatras.
sawariyan ku lra ’azi mena’u kaninu, alra mu atras u lra?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: ai, saleman misama’ za makatelun hamayan ku atrasan.
semever u lra maku?
’azi, pakumelri u.
varivariw u lra?
’azi, semever ku lra.
semever u lra?
ai, makatelun koking ku ika’alaluzun harem.
auwa u i iyan?
auwa ku i pankungse maya’a kana sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: auwa i iyan i Masaw?
aawa ’ematelra kana ’a’atelr i intaw.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: ulra i iyan i Masaw?
i intaw ulra i pakulalimayan, nu haremay mu aawa kima’ariya kana pakulalima.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: ulra i iyan i Sunay? nu haremay mu auwa kima’ariya kana pavavekasan.
S.TRANSL: Sunay在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Sunay? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: ulra i litang intaw, kay ku vavinayaw.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: salrangana ta mukuwa i lalinalinayan.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: kay ku ziya tremima’a za kara’a’alrien, nu haremay mu kay ku lra aya’aw u.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: salrangana ta mukuwa ’emaluwa kana trinavu!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: aya’ za zuma za trau, awa ku maya’ kani sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: harem kana wari i Masaw auwa kima’a’ariya kana mituwaketuk temepuk kana mali?
S.TRANSL: Is Masaw competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: ’azi, awa kimarepakuwaya kana munekun kana mareatras.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: nu pa’ari’ari nu azu mu uri kuwarelrang u kima’ari’ari?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ai, awa ku kima’a’ariya kana pavavekas.
nu pa’ari’ari nu azu mu kuwarelrang u kima’ari?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: awa ku kima’ariya kana mituwaketuk tremepuk kana mali.
nu pa’ari’ari nu azu mu uri kakuda ta?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: uri parepakuwa ta makakezeng kana lralrakitr.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: kana pa’ari’ari nu azu kana wari mu uri naniwan ta za akanen?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: ’azi, naniwan ta za ciciw.
wa melak u kana sanga, tatena’ u za kirevat!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: lrayuwan!
ulra i ruma’ i imu na vavayan?
ulra, ulra alrupe’ kanatu kiya’ezengan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: ulra i ruma’ i imu na vavayan?
iniyan, maw ziya upatratraran, waruma’ nu ’aremeng lra.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: ulra i ruma’ i imu na ma’inay?
ulra kazi itras kana kazazuwa rawangan uwa witras aya’u intaw.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: ulra trau i ruma’?
maw i Masaw, sawariyan ta lra ’azi mena’u kaninu, ’inava u ziya?
S.TRANSL: 是Masaw阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Masaw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: ’inava ku, zuwa ku maya’a kaninu kimazayazayara.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: ulra i iyan i temama?
ulra i sawka temusaasiyaw, kayku vavinayaw.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: mukuwa i iyan i Sunay?
mukuwa intaw i puvuyuyan ’emevanga za vuyu.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: imu, zuwa mi lra a!
ninmu temu uniyan i ruma’, ulra i ’uma i intaw, kazu i ruma’ ngangarayu za muruma’ i intaw.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: ama zuwa u lra!
sawariyan ta lra ’azi marepana’u, atras u lra.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: mena’u ku zanu izazuwa salaw ku semangal.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: ini na pangudangudalr mu vaveray kaninmu, puwayani kana palralritekan
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: sawriyan u lra ’azi zuwa, ku vavinayaw papiya zi salrangalrangana ta mekan.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: kaeman kemazu mavangavang, ’emau ku ziya kana alasepa mu aruwa. kayta i kalisuwasuwan mazayazayara.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: lrayuwan zanu sinadaluwan, averuk ku lra.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: inia na vuyu maw ziya kiyatruwak, adayu muruma’ tawatawaru lra mekan.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: inta zazuwa kemureta ta nu ’emanan nu alusu kadaw mu?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ai, uri paretratrevung ta i iyan?
maretrevunga ta i kungkuwan mu? kisaasing ta kana iga.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu kay ta i palakuwan, piyakavang ku kana ta kavang na kinawatranan mukuwa.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: nu mi’aputr na sakura kaniyam zekalr mu salaw vulay. ngarayu nu mi’aputr nu azu mu alamu lra aya’u ku!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu ngangara ta nu kaseveran lra, piwari lra zazu.
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu alamu lra nu kavarasa’an!
S.TRANSL: 那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: ’inava wa! salaw ku mengangara!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: kiumalra ku kaninu mazu zi mupasalr u zuwa i zekalr kazuwa?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: waruma’ ku awa ku patakesiya.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: mazu ’azi u patakesi i tokay?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: kana sare’az ku kana ku zekalr, zi pavulaliyas ku i zekalr zaku ikasaayhu.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: sayhu u semilretrav, maw i eman na panadam kaninu?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: maw i mulri na vavayan, i intaw mu maw na marasayhuyhu semilretrav kaniyam zekalr na trau.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: mazu mianger u za silralretravan?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: na semilralretrav mu niniyam kakuwayanan na kinawatranan, maranger ku tremungutrungulr kananiyam kakuwayanan na kinawatranan.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: ini na tinuwakutra kana dawa mu tatena’ imaran.
ninku tinuwakutra yi!
tatena’ u kana sayhu. nu tremuwakutra ta mu sawariyan?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ’azi, aruwa saliyusan maruwa. ta puwanay i lidingan demuru na lriketran nu maderu na lriketran nu lritek lra mu ta puwayay kana pikak ta triwtriwraw, zi ta puwanay lra i urauratran.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: ulra eman nannu inaniwan?
kani kaninku mu ulra kamangulr zi lukiw, ninku isalem peniya yi!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: tremima’a ku kanini na zazuwaya pidaya paisu?
marepukasa peniya mu zuwa leman misama’ za makalruwatr paisu.
sahar ku kanini na kavang, pidaya paisu?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: inia mu lruwatr leman paisu.
pazangal zazu, ’azi kararuwa demulu?
S.TRANSL: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: ’azi, nu ku duluwaw mu kasasipun ku.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

S.FORM: ai, nu kemazu mu tremima’a ku za saya na ’uze’uzem na kavang.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku kanini na tazaw maw ini na daderuwan.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: ta pukasayaw mu zuwa kuzulr paisu, i ini mu ninku linalimayan demaway, zi kararuwa u sawariyan mieman.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: ku pakazalramay ku aliali’an zuwa tremima’a, kararuwa u ziyan kemadulu?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: halra! ku duluwaw nu saleman mu ku lehetray zi makawalun lra.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: alamu na’u! na kavang na talupung ulra peniya.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: kiumalra ku ziya na kavang mu pidaya paisu?
saya na kavang mu telu leman misama’ za makalruwatr paisu, nu tateluwa mu sakuzulr paisu.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za saya maruwa, alra verayay ku kana vekal.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: ’inavayan, maranger ku tremima’ za sinaemay zi na ’alum na pinuwayan za lungan.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: muniwan lra na sinaemay. ulra ziya na pinuwayan za tana’a na siniyan na udungku. tratrima’ u?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: halr! alra verayay ku za saya, nu masalr mu tremima’a ku lra za maderu.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ai, kuwa avakaw kana avakan, kemani mu makalruwatr paisu.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.
